definitions: intense enthusiasm and energy for activities or pursuits
outer colored skin of citrus fruit used for flavoring food
examples: She approached every project with remarkable zest and creativity
His zest for life was infectious and uplifting
Add lemon zest to the cake batter for extra flavor
The recipe calls for orange zest and fresh thyme

definitions: sixth letter of the Greek alphabet used in mathematics and science
examples: The zeta function plays a crucial role in number theory
Students learned to write zeta in their Greek alphabet exercises

definitions: sudden sharp change in direction forming part of a zigzag pattern
examples: The path made a sharp zig to the left before continuing
After the zig comes a zag in the opposite direction

definitions: massive terraced pyramid structure built in ancient Mesopotamia with successively receding levels
examples: The ancient ziggurat of Ur still stands in modern Iraq
Archaeologists discovered remnants of a ziggurat dating back four thousand years

definitions: pattern consisting of sharp turns alternating between left and right
path or movement that proceeds by sharp turns in alternating directions
examples: The lightning created a bright zigzag across the night sky
She sewed a decorative zigzag pattern along the hem
The mountain trail follows a zigzag route to the summit
The child ran in a playful zigzag across the playground

definitions: bluish-white metallic element used in galvanizing and alloys with atomic number thirty
examples: Zinc coating prevents steel from rusting in outdoor conditions
The doctor recommended zinc supplements to boost her immune system

definitions: black-skinned wine grape variety producing robust red wines primarily grown in California
examples: The restaurant served an excellent California zinfandel with dinner
White zinfandel became popular as a sweet ros√© wine

definitions: energetic quality that makes something exciting or interesting
sharp high-pitched sound like that of a fast-moving object
examples: The salsa needs more lime juice to give it extra zing
Her presentation had the zing needed to capture everyone's attention
The arrow made a zing as it flew past his ear
We heard the zing of bullets ricocheting off metal

definitions: numeric postal code used for mail sorting in the United States
energetic quality or liveliness in movement or manner
informal term meaning nothing or zero amount
examples: Please include your zip code on the shipping address form
The package was sorted according to its five-digit zip
She performed the routine with incredible zip and enthusiasm
The coffee gave him the zip he needed this morning
The home team scored zip in the first half
I know zip about quantum physics

definitions: sliding fastener consisting of interlocking teeth closed or opened by a sliding tab
examples: The zipper on my jacket got stuck halfway up
She invented a waterproof zipper for diving suits

definitions: windproof metal cigarette lighter with hinged lid made by Zippo Manufacturing Company
examples: His grandfather's engraved Zippo became a treasured family heirloom
The soldier carried a Zippo lighter throughout his service

definitions: crystalline mineral gemstone resembling diamond used in jewelry and industrial applications
examples: The jeweler explained that zircon is often mistaken for diamond
Blue zircon from Cambodia is highly prized by collectors

definitions: white crystalline oxide of zirconium used in ceramics and synthetic gemstones
examples: Cubic zirconia serves as an affordable diamond alternative in jewelry
Dental crowns made from zirconia are extremely durable

definitions: stringed instrument with strings stretched over a flat soundbox played by plucking
examples: She played traditional Austrian folk songs on the zither
The haunting zither melody echoed through the concert hall

definitions: celestial coordinate system of twelve divisions used in astrology
type of inflatable boat with rigid hull used for marine operations
examples: She checked her zodiac sign's horoscope every morning
The zodiac wheel displays all twelve astrological signs
The coast guard deployed a zodiac to reach the stranded sailors
Military teams use zodiac boats for amphibious operations

definitions: reanimated corpse in folklore and horror fiction lacking consciousness
person who appears lifeless, exhausted, or lacking awareness
examples: The movie featured zombies rising from their graves at midnight
Zombie apocalypse stories have become extremely popular in media
After working three night shifts, she felt like a zombie
Students wandered the campus like zombies during finals week

definitions: area distinguished by specific characteristics, boundaries, or designated purpose
mental state of complete focus and optimal performance
examples: The city created a pedestrian-only zone in the downtown area
Plants suitable for your climate zone will thrive better
Athletes describe being in the zone during peak performance
Once she entered the zone, her productivity soared dramatically

definitions: legal mechanism dividing municipalities into districts with specific land use regulations
examples: The city's zoning laws prohibit commercial buildings in residential areas
They applied for a zoning variance to build their business

definitions: facility where wild animals are kept for public display and conservation
informal term for a chaotic or uncontrolled situation
examples: The zoo's new elephant habitat spans over three acres
Children love visiting the petting zoo during summer vacation
The shopping mall was a complete zoo on Black Friday
Managing that project became an absolute zoo by the deadline

definitions: scientist who studies animals, their behavior, physiology, classification, and distribution
examples: The zoologist spent years studying primate behavior in the rainforest
Marine zoologists discovered several new species in the deep ocean

definitions: scientific study of animals including their structure, physiology, development, and classification
examples: She earned her doctorate in zoology specializing in marine mammals
The zoology department organized a field trip to study local wildlife

definitions: camera lens function that magnifies or reduces image size
rapid movement especially with a buzzing or humming sound
video conferencing platform for virtual meetings and communication
examples: Use the zoom lens to get a closer shot of the bird
The photographer adjusted the zoom to capture the entire landscape
The motorcycle zoomed past us on the highway
The kids zoomed around the playground with endless energy
Let's schedule a Zoom meeting for tomorrow afternoon
The company conducts all interviews via Zoom now

definitions: cylindrical green summer squash harvested while immature and tender
examples: She spiralized zucchini to make healthy vegetable noodles
The garden produced so much zucchini they gave it away

definitions: lively music genre from Louisiana combining blues, rhythm and blues, and Creole influences
examples: The festival featured authentic zydeco bands from southwest Louisiana
Dancing to zydeco music requires energy and enthusiasm

definitions: diploid cell resulting from fertilization of egg by sperm before embryonic development
examples: The zygote undergoes rapid cell division to form an embryo
Scientists studied zygote development under laboratory conditions

definitions: person or entity that creates, manufactures, or produces something
reference to God as the creator of all things
examples: The furniture maker crafted each piece by hand
She's a skilled maker of artisanal chocolates
They prayed to their Maker for guidance and strength
He went to meet his Maker at the age of ninety

definitions: native or inhabitant of Malawi, a landlocked country in southeastern Africa
examples: The Malawian athlete won gold at the Commonwealth Games
Many Malawians work in agriculture, particularly tobacco farming

definitions: member of ethnic group indigenous to Maritime Southeast Asia
Austronesian language spoken in Malaysia, Indonesia, Brunei, and Singapore
examples: The Malay community celebrates Hari Raya with great enthusiasm
Traditional Malay cuisine features rice, coconut, and spices
She studied Malay to communicate better during her stay in Malaysia
Malay serves as the national language of several Southeast Asian countries

definitions: Dravidian language spoken primarily in Kerala state of India with over thirty million speakers
examples: Malayalam cinema has gained international recognition for its storytelling
She learned Malayalam to connect with her grandmother's heritage

definitions: person or thing relating to former British Malaya or the Malay Peninsula
examples: The Malayan Emergency lasted from 1948 to 1960
Malayan tigers are critically endangered in the wild

definitions: native or citizen of Malaysia, a Southeast Asian country
examples: The Malaysian chef opened a restaurant featuring authentic local dishes
Malaysians celebrate diverse cultural festivals throughout the year

definitions: native or inhabitant of the Maldives, an island nation in the Indian Ocean
examples: The Maldivian guide showed tourists the best snorkeling spots
Maldivians have developed unique methods for sustainable fishing

definitions: organism that produces small gametes in sexual reproduction
person identifying with masculine gender characteristics
examples: Male lions are distinguished by their prominent manes
The study examined health differences between male and female patients
The form asked applicants to indicate whether they were male or female
Male students comprised sixty percent of the engineering program

definitions: native or inhabitant of Mali, a landlocked country in West Africa
examples: The Malian musician performed traditional songs on the kora
Many Malians speak Bambara as their primary language

definitions: native or inhabitant of Malta, an island nation in the Mediterranean
small white toy dog breed with long silky coat
Semitic language spoken in Malta with Italian and English influences
examples: The Maltese artist displayed paintings inspired by Mediterranean landscapes
Many Maltese work in the tourism and financial services sectors
Her Maltese dog required daily grooming to maintain its coat
The Maltese breed is known for being gentle and affectionate
Maltese uses a Latin script despite its Arabic origins
Children in Malta learn Maltese and English from an early age

definitions: person who believes population growth will outpace food supply causing widespread poverty
examples: Malthusians argue for population control to prevent resource depletion
The economist's Malthusian predictions proved overly pessimistic

definitions: informal or dialectal term for mother used especially in Wales and Ireland
examples: The child ran to his mam when he scraped his knee
She calls her mam every Sunday without fail

definitions: informal affectionate term for mother used by children and adults
examples: The toddler cried for her mama after waking from a nap
Even as adults, they still call her Mama out of respect

definitions: Spanish informal term for mother or mommy
slang term for an attractive woman in Latino culture
examples: The little boy called out 'Mami!' when he saw his mother
She lovingly refers to her grandmother as Mami
The song lyrics repeatedly used 'mami' as a term of endearment
In the club, someone called her mami while dancing

definitions: adult human male typically associated with masculine characteristics
human beings collectively regardless of sex or age
game piece used in chess, checkers, or similar board games
examples: The man helped carry groceries for his elderly neighbor
He grew from a boy into a responsible man
The history of man spans hundreds of thousands of years
Man has always sought to understand the universe
She moved her man forward two spaces on the board
In checkers, a man becomes a king when reaching the opposite end

definitions: member of ethnic group from Manchuria who founded China's Qing dynasty
Tungusic language historically spoken by the Manchu people
examples: The Manchu rulers adapted many Chinese governmental practices
Traditional Manchu clothing influenced modern Chinese fashion
Few people still speak Manchu as their native language today
Scholars work to preserve Manchu through historical documents

definitions: standard Chinese language based on Beijing dialect spoken by over a billion people
high-ranking government official especially in imperial China
small sweet orange with loose easily-peeled skin
examples: She studied Mandarin for three years before traveling to Beijing
Mandarin has four main tones that change word meanings
The mandarin wore elaborate silk robes signifying his rank
Provincial mandarins administered local government in imperial times
The children enjoyed mandarin oranges in their lunch boxes
Mandarin season peaks during the winter holidays

definitions: distinctive behavioral habit or way of speaking peculiar to an individual
sixteenth-century European art style characterized by elongated forms and unusual effects
examples: His mannerism of tapping his fingers revealed his nervousness
She had an endearing mannerism of tilting her head when thinking
The painting exemplified Mannerism with its twisted figures and unnatural colors
Mannerism bridged the gap between Renaissance and Baroque art

definitions: loose sleeveless cloak worn over other garments
layer of Earth between the crust and core composed of hot rock
role of leadership or responsibility passed from one person to another
examples: The wizard wore a dark mantle embroidered with silver stars
She wrapped her mantle tightly against the cold wind
The Earth's mantle contains magma that erupts through volcanoes
Scientists study seismic waves to understand mantle composition
He accepted the mantle of leadership after his father retired
She bore the mantle of family tradition with pride

definitions: person from the Isle of Man in the Irish Sea
breed of cat characterized by absence of tail or very short tail
Celtic language historically spoken on the Isle of Man
examples: The Manx sailor knew every cove around the island
Many Manx people work in the island's financial sector
Their Manx cat had only a small stub where the tail should be
The Manx breed originated on the Isle of Man centuries ago
Efforts continue to revive Manx as a living language
Road signs on the Isle of Man appear in both English and Manx

definitions: communist political philosophy developed by Mao Zedong emphasizing peasant revolution and continuous class struggle
examples: Maoism influenced revolutionary movements across Asia and Latin America
The students studied Maoism alongside other twentieth-century political theories

definitions: person who follows or supports the political philosophy of Mao Zedong
examples: The Maoist rebels controlled rural areas for decades
Former Maoists now participate in democratic politics

definitions: indigenous Polynesian people of New Zealand
Polynesian language of the Maori people, official in New Zealand
examples: The Maori elder performed a traditional welcome ceremony
Maori culture plays an important role in New Zealand identity
Children learn Maori alongside English in many New Zealand schools
The treaty was written in both English and Maori

definitions: third month of the year in many Romance languages
mark or blemish that spoils appearance or quality
examples: The conference is scheduled for late Mar this year
Mar is abbreviated from March in many calendars
A deep scratch would mar the table's polished surface
Nothing could mar their perfect wedding day

definitions: Indo-Aryan language spoken by over eighty million people primarily in Maharashtra state of India
examples: Marathi literature has a rich tradition spanning eight centuries
She writes poetry in both Marathi and English
